body.name: Victorinox Swiss Army 5.2003.15-X8 Fibrox Straight Chef's Knife Black 6 in
features: An all-purpose chef’s knife provides ultimate control to mince your way through any culinary challenge
Contemporary, textured handle with a non-slip grip -- even when wet; The handle is ergonomically designed to help minimize tension at the wrist and provides a much more comfortable grip
Hygienic, dishwasher safe, slip-resistant and NSF approved; These exceptional knives are weighted and balanced for easy handling
Ergonomically designed, non-slip Fibrox Pro handle provides a sure grip and easy handling even when wet, making each knife safer and more efficient
body.description: Smooth cuts every time: that's the promise the Fibrox Office Knife makes. This reliable kitchen tool will stand up to everything laid out before it on the cutting board. A thin, sharp, 15 cm blade combines with balanced design and an ergonomic handle to deliver supreme comfort and controlled, precise, consistent cuts to everything from meat to vegetables through to fruit of all sizes. Though made for the home kitchen, our Fibrox line is professional in character, meaning it's as sought after by chefs as by cooks, to conquer any kitchen challenge, no matter the size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good knife, can substitute for a utility or paring knife.
reviews.reviewText: Although a bit disappointed that it is not as stiff as my 8" Victorinox blade, I was pleasantly surprised that because the b lade is thinner, it easily slices pretty much everything very well. The handle, despite its plasticky feel, it is effect a very comfortable and fit in your hand, causing you to feel secure and allowing for nice accurate work. Over time, I am finding that I no longer rely on my Chef's knife as much, as more and more cutting tasks are transferred to this nice knife. NOW, ABOUT THE FLEXIBILITY. I was hoping for a stiffer blade and wonder if I can use it in hard cuts like carrots, or hard squash. It is very light weigh, so power really has to come from you, which may scare some people.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great value, really small "chef's knife"
reviews.reviewText: This is almost exactly what I was looking for. A 6 inch blade, with a great finish and REALLY sharp. I also like the plastic handle because I know it will last a lifetime. And it is pretty darned thin at the spine, which makes it great for cutting hard vegetables.I purchased this knife for those jobs that I don't want to pull out a large chef's knife. I don't find an 8 inch chef's knife to be particularly useful (especially those with a thick spine), so a 6", in combination with my (thin-spined) 9" Japanese chef's knife, is perfect.Did I mention it's really sharp? Among the sharpest I've seen straight out of the box. This seems to be a core characteristic of the Victorinox knives I've bought recently.This knife (and all Victorinox knives I've purchased so far) is a great value for the quality of the blade you get. While it's a stamped blade, it rivals some Japanese brands in quality and fit and finish.Recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just as described with a beautiful edge.
reviews.reviewText: Super sharp. Cutting meat is a breeze. Great price for those on a limited income and buying cheaper cuts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredibly nice knife
reviews.reviewText: Purchased it for my wife, who needed some upgraded kitchen tools. She loves it- it's virtually one of the only knives she uses. I've used it a lot as well and am impressed how well it cuts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Saw this knife reviewed online and decided to give it a shot. I have a number of victorinox paring knifes which I love and this one doesn't disappoint. It's light and well balanced with a handle has a secure feel. The blade is thin which is great for dicing vegetables.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Comes very sharp! Feels good in the hand without being heavy. Good value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm in Love With This Knife! So sharp. Highly recommend,
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I saw it in a social media ad. I have a drawer full of German knives and Cutco. Thisis amazing. It is so sharp and works so well. I have a different-sized knife coming tomorrow. I highly recommend this knife.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent budget knife
reviews.reviewText: This knife was top rated on the "America's Test Kitchen" show on PBS. Thought I'd give it a try. It is a very nice knife and is very sharp. Price is reasonable. Only used it for about 30 minutes total so far and it still cuts great. I do wish it had a bit more room between the handle and the cutting board though.
Excelente filo. La marca es una garantía de calidad.

Perfect size for just about any kitchen work with a very comfortable handle, as with any Victorinox they are very easy to sharpen and keep sharp compared to many of the usual European traditional knives that we have had over the years but after getting a Victorinox for Christmas from my daughter many years ago we gradually replaced all eight knives as they so easy to maintain and comfortable to use. Four years ago I came back from Japan with a very expensive similarly shaped kitchen knife to this one, beautifully made and incredibly sharp but we always seem to end up using the Victorinox at a tenth of the cost and performs the same, the beautiful Japanese knives require more care as its easy to chip or break the edges and a more sophisticated sharpening technique.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Muy buen cuchillo ligero y un filo excelente

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Super sharp , light with non slip handle , the blade is thin which I prefer , ideal size for most uses
